text: <@UUE6E1LA1> has joined the channel

Hi. I just signed up here on the recommendation from someone on bet angel forum. I'm into automated IP horse racing mainly. Just started using GPS and trying to find like minded types. Anyone here use GPS?

elements.text: Hi. I just signed up here on the recommendation from someone on bet angel forum. I'm into automated IP horse racing mainly. Just started using GPS and trying to find like minded types. Anyone here use GPS?

text: yep

elements.text: yep

text: You notice any odd errors in the positions? I'm pretty sure my rendering code is as accurate but I get some very strange offset errors at times. Obviously I can't rule out bugs (who can) - do you see these things too?

elements.text: You notice any odd errors in the positions? I'm pretty sure my rendering code is as accurate but I get some very strange offset errors at times. Obviously I can't rule out bugs (who can) - do you see these things too?

text: yeah positions will bounce around between 'real' updates, they are limited to the number of updates over a particular timeframe (something to do with ofcom) therefore they derive the position. If you are clever you can work out the real updates

elements.text: yeah positions will bounce around between 'real' updates, they are limited to the number of updates over a particular timeframe (something to do with ofcom) therefore they derive the position. If you are clever you can work out the real updates

text: That was me on the forum by the way, D C. I use the API, but probably not using it to the fullest of potential yet. I’ve been meaning to do more with it, but just realised I haven’t been storing the data from the last year! Which is a bit of a bugger.

elements.text: That was me on the forum by the way, D C. I use the API, but probably not using it to the fullest of potential yet. I’ve been meaning to do more with it, but just realised I haven’t been storing the data from the last year! Which is a bit of a bugger.

text: I'm adjusting for latency as best I can to cater for asynchronous packet transmission from the sensors themselves but I still seem to get constant offset vectors. Even when in the stalls they don't always line up in what I would call a "line"

elements.text: I'm adjusting for latency as best I can to cater for asynchronous packet transmission from the sensors themselves but I still seem to get constant offset vectors. Even when in the stalls they don't always line up in what I would call a "line"

text: I’ve definitely had situations like you mentioned where a winner according to GPS wasn’t the actual winner! But that was a while ago, and I haven’t really looked into it since.

elements.text: I’ve definitely had situations like you mentioned where a winner according to GPS wasn’t the actual winner! But that was a while ago, and I haven’t really looked into it since.

text: yeah its just a limitation, i ignore them as they average out

elements.text: yeah its just a limitation, i ignore them as they average out

text: Yeah, exactly.

elements.text: Yeah, exactly.

text: You have had it for over a year? I just started at end of last year. So many potential angles with it and not enough time basically but this seems to be SO niche at present and seems not many people actually use it.

elements.text: You have had it for over a year? I just started at end of last year. So many potential angles with it and not enough time basically but this seems to be SO niche at present and seems not many people actually use it.

text: since March 2018

elements.text: since March 2018

text: Betfair have been slowly adding extra licenses for people who they think might want them.

elements.text: Betfair have been slowly adding extra licenses for people who they think might want them.

text: Well yeah I thought that they would average out but the errors I am getting often look like what you would see on a calibration error. I am (rightly or wrongly) expecting any error to be bivariate guassian with mean as the "true" position

elements.text: Well yeah I thought that they would average out but the errors I am getting often look like what you would see on a calibration error. I am (rightly or wrongly) expecting any error to be bivariate guassian with mean as the "true" position

text: Im doing OK with it don't get me wrong, I am just really curious about the nature and as a maths geek wondering if there is some clever filter that can "clean it up"

elements.text: Im doing OK with it don't get me wrong, I am just really curious about the nature and as a maths geek wondering if there is some clever filter that can "clean it up"

text: From what little info I have managed to get I understand that most people are looking at the opposite end of the race to me at the moment though.

elements.text: From what little info I have managed to get I understand that most people are looking at the opposite end of the race to me at the moment though.

text: I even had to query a race a month or so ago as it looked like the sensors were in the wrong horses from watching the replay. I was assured that was not the case though.

elements.text: I even had to query a race a month or so ago as it looked like the sensors were in the wrong horses from watching the replay. I was assured that was not the case though.

text: they have made that mistake before

elements.text: they have made that mistake before

text: i have a lot of checks that have to pass before i execute, the market can also be used to validate the feed but its never going to be perfect. Simply rounding up and playing the numbers game helps

elements.text: i have a lot of checks that have to pass before i execute, the market can also be used to validate the feed but its never going to be perfect. Simply rounding up and playing the numbers game helps

text: I screen record most of the races. Of course I can never know 100% that my render is 100% accurate but it generally seems good other than the odd "strange" result. I have never gone so far as to try and map the GPS to the racing line myself and rely on the API measure of distance to go as that is quite a complicated calculation to say the least

elements.text: I screen record most of the races. Of course I can never know 100% that my render is 100% accurate but it generally seems good other than the odd "strange" result. I have never gone so far as to try and map the GPS to the racing line myself and rely on the API measure of distance to go as that is quite a complicated calculation to say the least

text: I think with any kind of data source there’s always a risk of errors, so basically you need to manage your risk around that, and sometimes there’s not a huge amount you can do about it, but having the data feed is still better than not.

elements.text: I think with any kind of data source there’s always a risk of errors, so basically you need to manage your risk around that, and sometimes there’s not a huge amount you can do about it, but having the data feed is still better than not.

text: Oh totally agree. I am not being critical just wish I could understand why. It's very useful indeed and I have more ideas of how to use it than hours to implement them. Really just getting started out but I like to understand the data first - hence rendering the positions.

elements.text: Oh totally agree. I am not being critical just wish I could understand why. It's very useful indeed and I have more ideas of how to use it than hours to implement them. Really just getting started out but I like to understand the data first - hence rendering the positions.

text: I think it’s probably good to feedback to Betfair and TPD though too. I’m not sure how closely they monitor their own data, but obviously users like us are going to analyse the data extremely closely. It’s a relatively new company as far as I know, so I’m sure they’d appreciate anything you tell them.

elements.text: I think it’s probably good to feedback to Betfair and TPD though too. I’m not sure how closely they monitor their own data, but obviously users like us are going to analyse the data extremely closely. It’s a relatively new company as far as I know, so I’m sure they’d appreciate anything you tell them.

text: After all, the better their feed becomes, the more money they’ll probably make. They’re expanding into the US as well, so it might be a big thing one day.

elements.text: After all, the better their feed becomes, the more money they’ll probably make. They’re expanding into the US as well, so it might be a big thing one day.

text: Ive sent a few videos back asking the question. Im sure TPD must have some accurate playback rendering software. I don't know much about GPS tech at all really so don't know what kind of environmental factors can affect the readings.

elements.text: Ive sent a few videos back asking the question. Im sure TPD must have some accurate playback rendering software. I don't know much about GPS tech at all really so don't know what kind of environmental factors can affect the readings.

text: Yes indeed. If it helps the IP horse markets in other contries pick up that would be great

elements.text: Yes indeed. If it helps the IP horse markets in other contries pick up that would be great

text: they have a similar gui to yourself, positions overlayed onto google maps (i think), they monitor latency and accuracy, replacing any trackers which aren't up to scratch

elements.text: they have a similar gui to yourself, positions overlayed onto google maps (i think), they monitor latency and accuracy, replacing any trackers which aren't up to scratch

text: I see. It is good to know that they do monitor things then. I have noticed that the accuracy at some tracks appears to be a lot better than at others. I guess maybe I should not worry about it and perhaps focus on the more stable parts of the race where 100% accuracy is not essential.

elements.text: I see. It is good to know that they do monitor things then. I have noticed that the accuracy at some tracks appears to be a lot better than at others. I guess maybe I should not worry about it and perhaps focus on the more stable parts of the race where 100% accuracy is not essential.

text: Out of interest how many people do you think are currently using GPS as part of their automation?

elements.text: Out of interest how many people do you think are currently using GPS as part of their automation?

text: i know a rough count of the licenses but I don't believe many are using it, well I cant see them in the markets :slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text: i know a rough count of the licenses but I don't believe many are using it, well I cant see them in the markets

text: Not sure as they’ve been adding new licenses. I remember at the beginning Betfair almost ended the contract after the trial, but then they extended it and it seems it’s been worth it for them since. Must be more than 10 people but less than like 50. When I contacted TPD directly they were charging £70 per meeting, so Betfair must have agreed a bulk license otherwise it’d start adding up!

elements.text: Not sure as they’ve been adding new licenses. I remember at the beginning Betfair almost ended the contract after the trial, but then they extended it and it seems it’s been worth it for them since. Must be more than 10 people but less than like 50. When I contacted TPD directly they were charging £70 per meeting, so Betfair must have agreed a bulk license otherwise it’d start adding up!

text: This is the first place I have seen this discussed openly. I have been keeping this under my hat for what seems like a long time now.

elements.text: This is the first place I have seen this discussed openly. I have been keeping this under my hat for what seems like a long time now.

text: The betfair element that is, not TPD

elements.text: The betfair element that is, not TPD

text: I contacted TPD and they said 30 per meeting. I think I worked that out at 1200 a month.

elements.text: I contacted TPD and they said 30 per meeting. I think I worked that out at 1200 a month.

text: its been in the premium newsletter a few times, the end goal for betfair is to remove the 'courtsiders', take lots out and don't pay much commission

elements.text: its been in the premium newsletter a few times, the end goal for betfair is to remove the 'courtsiders', take lots out and don't pay much commission

text: + more liquidity

elements.text: + more liquidity

text: I think it’s because no one really asks. Nothing from Betfair suggests that any of it should be secretive.

elements.text: I think it’s because no one really asks. Nothing from Betfair suggests that any of it should be secretive.

text: Ah unfortunately I am a long way off of receiving that premium newsletter. No I did ask and just found it more sensible because I did not want to rock the boat and get it taken away. Although I have seen enough now that I would probably get it off TPD if I did lose it

elements.text: I wonder if it will become "mainstream" then and an additional part of the overall API one day

text: Well I am very glad to have found this place. Its been driving me crazy to have no outlet for this stuff.

text: Yeah, I only joined a couple weeks ago and I can’t believe there’s 400 members!

text: I did not know what slack was until this afternoon. Ive been botting for years - been aware of the github project too despite python not being "my thing" yet. Been a member of a few forums over the years (remember <http://fred77.co.uk|fred77.co.uk> ??) but this seems the best dev focused place. Even started my own telegram room to try and get some savvy people on board and reduce the twitter noise. This looks a better fit all round.
